str2: Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Perhaps from paio; a boy, or, a girl, and a child; specially, a slave or servant.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
Afflicted with paralysis. From a derivative of paraluo; as if dissolved, i.e. 'paralytic'.
Vehemently, terribly, grievously. Adverb from a derivative of the same as deilos; terribly, i.e. Excessively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To examine, as by torture; I torment; I buffet, as of waves. From basanos; to torture.
